title: Processes - Diff Eq Separation of Variables

content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the particular solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, y squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="f of 1, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives an expression for <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and its domain?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 2 x, minus 1, and denominator x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x not equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 2 x, minus 1, and denominator x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 minus x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x not equal to 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 minus x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x less than 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 2 minus x, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x less than 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
